de.tum.bgu.lfk.puicomponents.charts

Class BarChart

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.tum.bgu.lfk.puicomponents.charts.BarChart

  • public class BarChart
extends java.lang.Object
    a bar chart in processing. its like a time series only one bar per data point. TODO should be independent from ...datahandling.table should work with processing table
    Since:
    12.06.2014
    Version:
    0.0.2
    Author:
    Mathias Jahnke, Technische Universität München, Department of Cartography

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      BarChart()
      default constructor
      BarChart(processing.core.PApplet p)
      parameterized constructor to have a bar chart covering the whole canvas.
      BarChart(processing.core.PApplet p, int x, int y, int w, int h)
      parameterized constructor

    • Constructor Detail

      • BarChart

        public BarChart()
        default constructor

      • BarChart

        public BarChart(processing.core.PApplet p)
        parameterized constructor to have a bar chart covering the whole canvas.
        Parameters:
        p - the PApplet to draw on

      • BarChart

        public BarChart(processing.core.PApplet p,
        int x,
        int y,
        int w,
        int h)
        parameterized constructor
        Parameters:
        p - the PApplet to draw on
        x - coordinate of the upper left corner of the chart
        y - coordinate of the upper left corner of the chart
        w - width of the chart in pixel
        h - height of the chart in pixel

    • Method Detail

      • setInterBarMargin

        public void setInterBarMargin(int margin)
        to set the inter bar margin. the margin to set has to be indicated as the half between two bars in pixel- standard value is 2 pixel.
        Parameters:
        margin - half of the margin between two bars (in pixel)

      • setAxisColor

        public void setAxisColor(int color)
        to set the color for the axis of the bar chart a standard value is set with the constructors
        Parameters:
        color - the axis color to set

      • setAxisWeight

        public void setAxisWeight(int weight)
        sets the axis weight standard value is 1 pixel
        Parameters:
        weight - the weight to set in pixel

      • setData

        public void setData(Table data,
           int idCol,
           int dataCol)
        sets the data to draw the bar chart
        Parameters:
        data - the data
        dataCol - the column of the data array which should be drawn
        idCol - the column in which to find the id for the data (not yet used)

      • setChartStyling

        public void setChartStyling(int chartColor,
                   boolean chartOutline,
                   int chartOutlineColor)
        to set the styling for the whole chart standard values are set with the parameterized constructors
        Parameters:
        chartColor - the background color of the chart
        chartOutline - if the chart should have an outline
        chartOutlineColor - the color of the chart's outline

      • setDataStyling

        public void setDataStyling(int dataColor,
                  boolean dataOutline,
                  int dataOutlineColor)
        to set the styling for the bars representing the data standard values are set with the paraemterized constructor
        Parameters:
        dataColor - background color of the bars
        dataOutline - if every data bar should have an outline
        dataOutlineColor - the color for the outline

      • setMargins

        public void setMargins(int topMargin,
              int bottomMargin,
              int leftMargin,
              int rightMargin)
        sets the margins (spacing) between the data and the border of the chart. top, bottom, left and right margins can be set if topMargin + bottomMargin exceeds h or if leftMargin + rightMarging exceeds w standard values which are set by the parameterized constructors are used
        Parameters:
        topMargin - in pixel (standard value 3 pixel)
        bottomMargin - in pixel (standard value 3 pixel)
        leftMargin - in pixel (standard value 3 pixel)
        rightMargin - in pixel (standard value 3 pixel)

      • setAxisStyling

        public void setAxisStyling(int color,
                  int weight)
        to set the axis Styling at once
        Parameters:
        color - the axis color
        weight - the stroke width for the axis

      • setHighlightStyling

        public void setHighlightStyling(int color,
                       boolean fill,
                       boolean outline,
                       int strokeWeight)
        sets the highlight styling emphasize the bar. a combination of the parameters fill and outline is possible
        Parameters:
        color - the color to highlight the bar
        fill - true if the bar should highlighted by a fill
        outline - true if the bar should be highlighted by a outline
        strokeWeight - the weight of the outline stroke

      • isInside

        public java.lang.String isInside(int mx,
                        int my)
        checks if the mouse is located in one of the bars. if the mouse is located inside a bar the according data id is returned therefore the idColumn has to be specified
        Parameters:
        mx - position x in screen coordinates like from mouseX
        my - position y in screen coordinates like from mouseY
        Returns:
        the id of the bar in which the mx and my values are located if not inside "noId" is returned

      • highlightData

        public void highlightData(java.lang.String id)
        highlights the bar according the the id
        Parameters:
        id - the id to bar which should be highlighted

      • drawChart

        public void drawChart()
        have to be called to draw the chart. values for chart styling like color and outline can be set via the different set methods otherwise standard values are set via constructors
